summary: This is an email chain from January 2, 2008, between U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta and other federal prosecutors in West Palm Beach, discussing press coverage of the Jeffrey Epstein case. They are gathering Palm Beach Post articles and a letter from Police Chief Reiter to State Attorney Barry Krischer, and mention the public release of arrest affidavits for Epstein and others via The Smoking Gun website.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Recipient and sender in the email chain, asking about obtaining a letter related to the Epstein case without using public sources.

persons.name: Reiter
persons.context: Mentioned as the author of a letter sent to Barry Krischer regarding the Epstein investigation; the letter is referenced in press coverage.

persons.name: Barry Krischer
persons.context: Recipient of a letter from Police Chief Reiter; his office's actions are described as having 'basically shut down the case'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the press coverage and police investigation; arrest affidavits for him and others became public.

connections.description: Police Chief Reiter sent a letter to State Attorney Barry Krischer regarding the Epstein investigation.
Alex Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, is involved in correspondence about gathering documents and press coverage related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Publication of Epstein arrest affidavits
events.description: The Smoking Gun website published redacted probable cause affidavits for the arrests of Jeffrey Epstein and others, after the police investigation was deemed closed.

events.title: Palm Beach Post articles
events.description: Multiple Palm Beach Post articles from July and August 2006 are referenced as part of the press coverage being collected.

events.title: Email exchange on Epstein press
events.description: Federal prosecutors exchange emails gathering documents and discussing how to obtain a letter from Police Chief Reiter related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: In January 2008, U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta was actively seeking documents and press coverage related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
Police Chief Reiter wrote a letter to State Attorney Barry Krischer regarding the Epstein case, which prosecutors were trying to obtain.
The State Attorney's Office was perceived to have 'basically shut down the case', leading the police to deem their investigation closed.
Once the police investigation was closed, probable cause affidavits for the arrests of Jeffrey Epstein and others became public and were published by The Smoking Gun.
The email chain shows federal prosecutors gathering historical press articles from the Palm Beach Post dating back to 2006 about the Epstein case.
